revised_title: Explaining the Annual Variation of the Earth's Magnetism
tldr: Professor Langberg proposes a hypothesis that the annual variation of the Earth's magnetism is due to the sun's magnetic action and its position in the orbit. He suggests that the sun has magnetic poles and that its magnetic axis may not coincide with its axis of rotation. This hypothesis could explain the observed changes in the Earth's magnetic declination and the connection with the sun's position during the year.
